address: Xã Hoằng Quỳ, Huyện Hoằng Hóa, Tỉnh Thanh Hóa
thought:
**Analysis of Administrative Unit Changes for "Xã Hoằng Quỳ"**

Okay, so I'm presented with the old administrative address "Xã Hoằng Quỳ, Huyện Hoằng Hóa, Tỉnh Thanh Hóa" and need to determine its new equivalent. First, I identify the province as "Tỉnh Thanh Hóa" and the ward as "Xã Hoằng Quỳ."

My initial check confirms that "Tỉnh Thanh Hóa" is *not* undergoing any province-level merger, according to Resolution 60-NQ/TW. This narrows my focus to the ward level.

Now, I dive into the available resolutions. Specifically, I zero in on Resolution 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15, concerning administrative adjustments within Thanh Hóa province. I scan the lines, and bingo, line 26 jumps out: it clearly states that "Xã Hoằng Quỳ" is *merged* with "Hoằng Xuân, Hoằng Hợp và Hoằng Giang" to form a new ward named "Xã Hoằng Giang."

I then cross-reference this finding against my "New wards" list and confirm the existence of "Xã Hoằng Giang" with code "15880" under "Tỉnh Thanh Hóa."  This is exactly what I expected.

My analysis gives a very high level of confidence in this finding because of the direct and explicit mention of the old ward. I did one quick double check on other resolutions to ensure that no conflict exists, and no other resolutions mention "Hoằng Quỳ".
Therefore, the updated address should be "Xã Hoằng Giang, Huyện Hoằng Hóa, Tỉnh Thanh Hóa", with the ward code "15880".  The relevant citation will be Resolution 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15, line 26.

citation.header: 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Thanh Hóa
citation.line: 26. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Hoằng Xuân, Hoằng Quỳ, Hoằng Hợp và Hoằng Giang thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Hoằng Giang.
